Great game, especially when playing with friends.

If you want real co-op survival horror game, then you should at least play killing floor once. Not like any other survival horror games, you have to play as a team. Move one point to another as a team. If you like to play solo, you should prepare for your doom because killing floor is not like walking in the park. If you get lost in the map or get seperated from your team, you have to find a way to get back to your team or you will die mostly. I'm playing this game about years and I can say that it's absolutely fun. You have to get this game and play it!

So much fun and has a ton of playability. Mostly enjoyable to play with friends. There's no campaign though there are maps that have objectives and a "story" rather than just wave based gameplay. There are always a huge amount of servers running and the community is big enough to be able to find a full lobby year round. Totally worth the $20 so if you see it on sale don't hesitate to purchase it. Honestly, writing a review about it makes me wanna go play it now...
the best and always will be the best co-op 6 player zombie game hands down!
This is a cool game!

If you're a fan of "horde"-type shooters, you'll love the hell out of this. Join a match, camp a corner, shoot all the zombies, visit the shop to buy items, rinse and repeat a thousand times over. That's pretty much all there is to Killing Floor.

Pea-shooter guns. Washed-out graphics. A community that gravitates towards extreme uptightness. Unappealingly drab maps. Boring gunplay and wonky secondary mechanics. The upside is that Killing Floor still has a large and active fanbase, so there's that.

I think that this game is very fun! The game play seems to be the best when you have a friend to play with you. So if you decide you want to purchase this game, I would concider getting a friend to buy it with you. 

The game's graphics are fair and the gameplay is well designed. The one downside is that there is no sprint in the game or crouching. It makes you feel somwhat limited to what you can do, but I think it is still worth buying!

One of the most addicting coop shooters i have ever played. Very good gun play and nice variety of creatures. You must play as a team or you will not survive. When you play with a good team there are few games that feel as satisfiying as this one. A must own for any shooting fan.

Good, quick, dumb fun.  A mob wave based shooter where cash is awarded for kills, headshots, etc, where that money is spent on guns, armor, grenades, and ammo for the next wave.  Great game for a quick fix of it's type of gameplay, and great seasonal events to go with the game as well.  ^_^

Killing floor is a nice co-op survival horror FPS.Up to 6 players in online co-op mode, or just you, on your own, playing the Solo mode. The aim, cleanse each area of zombies, in waves, until you get to the last one. The Big One. The Patriarch. Then exterminate him, too. Actually, they aren’t "zombies". They are the left-over "specimens" from a cheap and dirty government program to clone soldier-monsters

Killing Floor is a great FPS-Horror-MMO-Money-Management-Wave-Fighting, or FHMMMWF Game, by Tripwire Interactive. Also, it's truly terrifying. You never know when a Fleshpound will meet you at the next corner. It's important to select a class that you can work well with, and, it may take a long time to get to Level 6, but it's well worth it.

And don't forget about the Downloadable Content! There's more than a dozen Character packs, including Nightfall, Outbreak, and character packs with only one character, like Mrs. Foster or Harold Lott.

There's also 6 weapon packs, 3 of which are completely useless (Reskins), and 3 of which aren't useless, the Us Vs. Them pack, And Community Packs 1 & 2.

Overall, Killing Floor is a must have if you enjoy killing [strike] zombies [/strike] clones in the countryside of London (and some other areas, too)
Some of the best online gameplay i have ever experenced.

Killing Floor is a Fast-Paced fun game, with many cool elements that make it all the more enjoyable, with a multitude of different DLC packs that all add different content to the game. And the best part about them is that they aren't mandatory or even all that necessary. They add alot to the gameplay and cosmetic aspects of the game, but they aren't needed, and the base game is just as fun.

KF has 10 waves where different types of zombies spawn and attack you, getting stronger and more numerous each wave. With 1 min in between to run to store to buy ammo and new weapons -if not found on map. Patriarch boss after 10th wave. Numerous maps, several difficulty levels, achievements, 6 player co-op, 7 classes that you level up with certain tasks. Commando pyro demolition medic sharpshooter berserker support. Definitely better with friends to play with you. Really enjoy this game!
